cards.flavor: It's on the rack next to ice lance, acid lance, and English muffin lance.
cards.name: Flame Lance
cards.text: Deal $8 damage to a minion.

cards.flavor: Burning man, brah.
cards.name: Effigy
cards.text: Secret: When a friendly minion dies, summon a random minion with the same Cost.

cards.flavor: And he can't get up.
cards.name: Fallen Hero
cards.text: Your Hero Power deals 1 extra damage.

cards.flavor: Now with 100% more blast!
cards.name: Arcane Blast
cards.text: Deal $2 damage to a minion. This spell gets double bonus from Spell Damage.

cards.flavor: It's always Huffer.
cards.name: Polymorph: Boar
cards.text: Transform a minion into a 4/2 Boar with Charge.

cards.flavor: Is he aspiring or inspiring?  Make up your mind!
cards.name: Dalaran Aspirant
cards.text: Inspire: Gain Spell Damage +1.

cards.flavor: Does he sling spells, or do his spells linger about.  Who can say?
cards.name: Spellslinger
cards.text: Battlecry: Add a random spell to each player's hand.

cards.flavor: The Grand Tournament has a "No dragons allowed" policy, but it's rarely enforced.
cards.name: Coldarra Drake
cards.text: You can use your Hero Power any number of times.

cards.flavor: A masterless shamurai.
cards.name: Rhonin
cards.text: Deathrattle: Add 3 copies of Arcane Missiles to your hand.

cards.flavor: Not getting trampled is really the trick here.
cards.name: Ram Wrangler
cards.text: Battlecry: If you have a Beast, summon a random Beast.

cards.flavor: She really likes seeing people get better.  That's why she hurts them in the first place.
cards.name: Holy Champion
cards.text: Whenever a character is healed, gain +2 Attack.

cards.flavor: What did you expect to happen?  He's a Spawn.  Of Shadows.
cards.name: Spawn of Shadows
cards.text: Inspire: Deal 4 damage to each hero.

cards.flavor: The promise of glory is a powerful tool to get minions to do your bidding.  Only slightly less powerful than the promise of an ice cream bar!
cards.name: Power Word: Glory
cards.text:
Choose a minion. Whenever it attacks, restore 4 Health to
your hero.

cards.flavor: Hopes to be promoted to "Shadowfriend" someday.
cards.name: Shadowfiend
cards.text: Whenever you draw a card, reduce its Cost by (1).

cards.flavor: "Are you interested in... HEALTH benefits?!"
cards.name: Convert
cards.text: Put a copy of an enemy minion into your hand.

cards.flavor: This minion is really powerful!
cards.name: Confuse
cards.text: Swap the Attack and Health of all minions.

cards.flavor: A result of magical experiments carried out by the Black Dragonflight, it's not his fault that he's a vicious killer.
cards.name: Twilight Guardian
cards.text: Battlecry: If you're holding a Dragon, gain +1 Attack and Taunt.

cards.flavor: She sees into your past and makes you face your fears.  Most common fear:  Getting Majordomo out of Sneed's Old Shredder.
cards.name: Confessor Paletress
cards.text: Inspire: Summon a random Legendary minion.

cards.flavor: Crescendo himself summoned this steed, riding it to victory in the Grand Tournament.  Wherever he rides, an army of riders ride behind him, supporting the legendary champion.
cards.name: Dreadsteed
cards.text: Deathrattle: At the end of the turn, summon a Dreadsteed.

cards.flavor: They were originally called Cuddleguards, but they were not inspiring the proper amount of fear.
cards.name: Fearsome Doomguard

cards.flavor: "No, no, no. I asked for a tiny JESTER of evil."
cards.name: Tiny Knight of Evil
cards.text: Whenever you discard a card, gain +1/+1.

cards.flavor: * Not actually Jaraxxus' fist.
cards.name: Fist of Jaraxxus
cards.text: When you play or discard this, deal $4 damage to a random enemy.

cards.flavor: We like to call him "Wesley".
cards.name: Void Crusher
cards.text: Inspire: Destroy a random minion for each player.

cards.flavor: Very dangerous when attached to a demonbomb.
cards.name: Demonfuse
cards.text: Give a Demon +3/+3. Give your opponent a Mana Crystal.

cards.flavor: A prime example of lose-lose negotiating.
cards.name: Dark Bargain
cards.text: Destroy 2 random enemy minions. Discard 2 random cards.

cards.flavor: After playing against 5 Annoy-O-Trons, any normal guard will become a Wrathguard.
cards.name: Wrathguard
cards.text: Whenever this minion takes damage, also deal that amount to your hero.

cards.flavor:
He can summon anything, even a FEARSOME DOOMGUARD*.
*He's pretty sure this is going to work out.
cards.name: Wilfred Fizzlebang
cards.text: Cards you draw from your Hero Power cost (0).

cards.flavor: He needed a break after that business in the Vale of Eternal Blossoms. Naturally, he chose to spend his vacation in an icy snowscape killing monsters.
cards.name: Shado-Pan Rider
cards.text: Combo: Gain +3 Attack.

cards.flavor: The best part of buccaneering is the pants.
cards.name: Buccaneer
cards.text: Whenever you equip a weapon, give it +1 Attack.

cards.flavor: Almost went to play for Stormwind before signing with Undercity.
cards.name: Undercity Valiant
cards.text: Combo: Deal 1 damage.

cards.flavor: He has a giant collection of purses now.  One for every outfit!
cards.name: Cutpurse
cards.text: Whenever this minion attacks a hero, add the Coin to your hand.

cards.flavor: I have great deal for you... for 4 damage to your face!
cards.name: Shady Dealer
cards.text: Battlecry: If you have a Pirate, gain +1/+1.

cards.flavor: Yoink!
cards.name: Burgle
cards.text: Add 2 random cards to your hand (from your opponent's class).

cards.flavor: How much more poisoned can a blade get?  The answer is a lot.  A lot more poisoned.
cards.name: Poisoned Blade
cards.text: Your Hero Power gives this weapon +1 Attack instead of replacing it.

cards.flavor: Can you hold these eggs for just a second?  I promise they're not full of giant enraged undead spider things.
cards.name: Beneath the Grounds
cards.text: Shuffle 3 Ambushes into your opponent's deck. When drawn, you summon a 4/4 Nerubian.

cards.flavor: Was actually a pretty nice guy before, you know, the whole Lich King thing.
cards.name: Anub'arak
cards.text: Deathrattle: Return this to your hand and summon a 4/4 Nerubian.

cards.flavor: 2 out of 2 saplings recommend that you summon the saplings.
cards.name: Living Roots
cards.text: Choose One - Deal $2 damage; or Summon two 1/1 Saplings.

cards.flavor: She loves mana crystals, she hates mana crystals.   So fickle!
cards.name: Darnassus Aspirant
cards.text: Battlecry: Gain an empty Mana Crystal. Deathrattle: Lose a Mana Crystal.

cards.flavor: Maybe if you whistle a tune it will soothe him.  Yeah...  Try that.
cards.name: Savage Combatant
cards.text: Inspire: Give your hero +2 Attack this turn.

cards.flavor: She was born to be something.  She is just not quite sure what yet...
cards.name: Wildwalker
cards.text: Battlecry: Give a friendly Beast +3 Health.

cards.flavor: He gets a discount on the tournament entry fee because he is his own horse.
cards.name: Knight of the Wild
cards.text: Whenever you summon a Beast, reduce the Cost of this card by (1).

cards.flavor: That's saberTEETH, not like curved pirate blades.  That's a different kind of druid.  Druid of the Curved Pirate Blades.
cards.name: Druid of the Saber

cards.flavor: Hey!  Moon!  Can I have some mana crystals?
cards.name: Astral Communion
cards.text: Gain 10 Mana Crystals. Discard your hand.

cards.flavor: Is this a noun or a verb?  We will never know.
cards.name: Mulch
cards.text:
Destroy a minion.
Add a random minion to your opponent's hand.

cards.flavor: Call her "Tweety".  She'll find it real funny.  I PROMISE.
cards.name: Aviana
cards.text: Your minions cost (1).

cards.flavor: Turns out the tuskarr aren't real choosy about their totems.
cards.name: Tuskarr Totemic
cards.text: Battlecry: Summon a random basic Totem.

cards.flavor: It's nice to find a real craftsman in this day and age of mass-produced totems.
cards.name: Draenei Totemcarver
cards.text: Battlecry: Gain +1/+1 for each friendly Totem.

cards.flavor: Favored by shaman who study the art of restoration and healing, this spell would feel smug, if it had feelings.
cards.name: Healing Wave
cards.text: Restore #7 Health. Reveal a minion in each deck. If yours costs more, Restore #14 instead.

cards.flavor: Allowing totems to attack is not cheating.  I mean, there isn't anything in the rule books about it.
cards.name: Thunder Bluff Valiant
cards.text: Inspire: Give your Totems +2 Attack.

cards.flavor: You can only pick it up if you are worthy.
cards.name: Charged Hammer
cards.text: Deathrattle: Your Hero Power becomes 'Deal 2 damage.'

cards.flavor: I'm not a shaman or anything, but isn't Elemental Destruction the opposite of what they want to do?
cards.name: Elemental Destruction
cards.text: Deal $4-$5 damage to all minions. Overload: (5)

cards.flavor: What happens when you glue a buncha totems together.
cards.name: Totem Golem
cards.text: Overload: (1)

cards.flavor: MOMMMMMYYYYYYYYY!!!
cards.name: Ancestral Knowledge
cards.text: Draw 2 cards. Overload: (2)

cards.flavor: Calling the mist doesn't sound all that great.  "Ooooh, it is slightly damp now!"
cards.name: The Mistcaller
cards.text: Battlecry: Give all minions in your hand and deck +1/+1.

cards.flavor: Flash!  Ahhhhhhh~
cards.name: Flash Heal
cards.text: Restore #5 Health.

cards.flavor: pow POW pow
cards.name: Powershot
cards.text: Deal $2 damage to a minion and the minions next to it.

cards.flavor: Takes way better care of her pets than her brother, Unstablemaster.
cards.name: Stablemaster
cards.text: Battlecry: Give a friendly Beast Immune this turn.

cards.flavor: Elekk jousting is AWESOME.
cards.name: King's Elekk
cards.text: Battlecry: Reveal a minion in each deck. If yours costs more, draw it.

cards.flavor: This is a "bearly" concealed reference.
cards.name: Brave Archer
cards.text: Inspire: If your hand is empty, deal 2 damage to the enemy hero.

cards.flavor: You'll never guess what's in that conveniently bear-sized, bear-smelling box.
cards.name: Bear Trap
cards.text: Secret: After your hero is attacked, summon a 3/3 Bear with Taunt.

cards.flavor:
Rexxar narrowed his eyes, grabbed his machine gun, and said: "It's go time.  Lock and load."
This card pays homage to that special moment.
cards.name: Lock and Load
cards.text: Each time you cast a spell this turn, add a random Hunter card to your hand.

cards.flavor: "THEY'RE EVERYWHERE GET THEM OFF!!!" - Everyone
cards.name: Ball of Spiders
cards.text: Summon three 1/1 Webspinners.

cards.flavor: With the help of his trusty sidekick Dreadscale, the giant jormungar Acidmaw is ready to face any knight!
cards.name: Acidmaw
cards.text: Whenever another minion takes damage, destroy it.

cards.flavor: Let's be clear about this:  ACIDMAW is the sidekick.
cards.name: Dreadscale
cards.text: At the end of your turn, deal 1 damage to all other minions.

cards.flavor: You might think bashing doesn't take a lot of practice.  It doesn't.
cards.name: Bash
cards.text:
Deal $3 damage.
Gain 3 Armor.

cards.flavor: "King's Attacker" is a shield.  Funny, huh?
cards.name: King's Defender
cards.text: Battlecry: If you have a minion with Taunt, gain +1 Durability.

cards.flavor: "Four out of three orcs struggle with math." - Angry Zurge
cards.name: Orgrimmar Aspirant
cards.text: Inspire: Give your weapon +1 Attack.

cards.flavor: Playing him also gets you into the Magnataur Beta.
cards.name: Magnataur Alpha
cards.text:
Also damages the minions next to whomever
he attacks.

cards.flavor: The best offense is a good defense.
cards.name: Bolster
cards.text: Give your Taunt minions +2/+2.

cards.flavor: Come at me, bro.
cards.name: Sparring Partner
cards.text: Taunt Battlecry: Give a minion Taunt.

cards.flavor: What's more boss than riding a parrot with a jawbone for a shoulderpad while wielding a giant hook-lance-thing and wearing a pirate hat?  NOTHING.
cards.name: Skycap'n Kragg
cards.text: Charrrrrge Costs (1) less for each friendly Pirate.

cards.flavor: "Put more spikes on her.  No, more spikes.  What part of 'more spikes' do you not understand?  MORE SPIKES!" - Alexstrasza
cards.name: Alexstrasza's Champion
cards.text: Battlecry: If you're holding a Dragon, gain +1 Attack and Charge.

cards.flavor: Leader of the Alliance!  Father of Anduin!  Also he likes to play Arena, and he averages 12 wins.
cards.name: Varian Wrynn
cards.text: Battlecry: Draw 3 cards. Put any minions you drew directly into the battlefield.

cards.flavor: Competition can be an inspiration to improve oneself.  Or kill all the competitors.
cards.name: Competitive Spirit
cards.text: Secret: When your turn starts, give your minions +1/+1.

cards.flavor: "Arf! Arf! Arf!" - Seal of Champions
cards.name: Seal of Champions
cards.text: Give a minion +3 Attack and Divine Shield.

cards.flavor: He doesn't even get Sundays off.  Every day he's hostling.
cards.name: Warhorse Trainer
cards.text: Your Silver Hand Recruits have +1 Attack.

cards.flavor: Hee hee!  Look at his cute little feet.
cards.name: Murloc Knight
cards.text: Inspire: Summon a random Murloc.

cards.flavor: The stripes make it look like a candy cane, but we recommend against licking it.
cards.name: Argent Lance
cards.text: Battlecry: Reveal a minion in each deck. If yours costs more, +1 Durability.

cards.flavor: You have to get past the vendors first.  So many are lost to shopping...
cards.name: Enter the Coliseum
cards.text: Destroy all minions except each player's highest Attack minion.

cards.flavor: He may sound surly and antisocial, but he's actually just really shy.
cards.name: Mysterious Challenger
cards.text: Battlecry: Put one of each Secret from your deck into the battlefield.

cards.flavor: He'll never admit it, but he pushes you hard because he really cares about you.
cards.name: Garrison Commander
cards.text: You can use your Hero Power twice a turn.

cards.flavor: Nobody rocks a monocle like Eadric.
cards.name: Eadric the Pure
cards.text: Battlecry: Change all enemy minions' Attack to 1.

cards.flavor: But not the lowliest!
cards.name: Lowly Squire
cards.text: Inspire: Gain +1 Attack.

cards.flavor: Check it out.  You can do barrel rolls on this thing.
cards.name: Dragonhawk Rider
cards.text: Inspire: Gain Windfury this turn.

cards.flavor: Lance Carrier is an obscure entry level position in orcish armies.  A mystery, since orcs don't generally use lances.
cards.name: Lance Carrier
cards.text: Battlecry: Give a friendly minion +2 Attack.

cards.flavor: Not a good basis for a system of government.
cards.name: Maiden of the Lake
cards.text: Your Hero Power costs (1).

cards.flavor: Listen all y'all it's a saboteur!
cards.name: Saboteur
cards.text: Battlecry: Your opponent's Hero Power costs (5) more next turn.

cards.flavor: His horse's name is Betsy.
cards.name: Argent Horserider
cards.text: Charge Divine Shield

cards.flavor: This champion has learned from the best.  Except for his target selection.
cards.name: Mogor's Champion
cards.text: 50% chance to attack the wrong enemy.

cards.flavor: Underneath all that impressive armor, he's just skin and bones.  Okay, maybe just bones.
cards.name: Boneguard Lieutenant
cards.text: Inspire: Gain +1 Health.

cards.flavor: An elegant gorilla, for a more civilized age.
cards.name: Mukla's Champion
cards.text: Inspire: Give your other minions +1/+1.

cards.flavor: The medic tournament is less entertaining than the Grand Tournament.
cards.name: Tournament Medic
cards.text: Inspire: Restore #2 Health to your hero.

cards.flavor: He's a lot cooler than Magma Rager.
cards.name: Ice Rager

cards.flavor: Ironically, the natural enemy of the snobold is THE CANDLE.
cards.name: Frigid Snobold
cards.text: Spell Damage +1

cards.flavor: At first he liked juggling chain saws, but then he thought, "Flames are better!  Because FIRE!"
cards.name: Flame Juggler
cards.text: Battlecry: Deal 1 damage to a random enemy.

cards.flavor: He used to be a librarian.  Old habits die hard.
cards.name: Silent Knight
cards.text: Stealth Divine Shield

cards.flavor: It takes a lot to wind him up.
cards.name: Clockwork Knight
cards.text: Battlecry: Give a friendly Mech +1/+1.

cards.flavor: He was so excited to get season tickets to this year's Grand Tournament.  He normally doesn't get them at first and has to buy them from Ogre scalpers.
cards.name: Tournament Attendee
cards.text: Taunt

cards.flavor: Hey!  Let me try that...
cards.name: Sideshow Spelleater
cards.text: Battlecry: Copy your opponent's Hero Power.

cards.flavor: Someone called her a Rhinorider, and she's NOT HAPPY.
cards.name: Kodorider
cards.text: Inspire: Summon a 3/5 War Kodo.

cards.flavor: The Silver Hand is the best paladin organization.  The Argent Crusaders are super jealous.
cards.name: Silver Hand Regent
cards.text: Inspire: Summon a 1/1 Silver Hand Recruit.

cards.flavor: What did the pits ever do to you?
cards.name: Pit Fighter

cards.flavor: You can keep him, but you have to promise to feed him and clean out his tank every day!
cards.name: Captured Jormungar

cards.flavor: You have no idea how tired this guy is of being released.
cards.name: North Sea Kraken
cards.text: Battlecry: Deal 4 damage.

cards.flavor: Just could not be talked out of using his turtle for the joust...
cards.name: Tuskarr Jouster
cards.text: Battlecry: Reveal a minion in each deck. If yours costs more, restore #7 Health to your hero.

cards.flavor: Don't worry.  With a little skin cream he's going to clear right up.
cards.name: Injured Kvaldir
cards.text: Battlecry: Deal 3 damage to this minion.

cards.flavor: When there's something strange (say, a gibbering demon) in your neighborhood, who are you going to call?
cards.name: Light's Champion
cards.text: Battlecry: Silence a Demon.

cards.flavor: Yep.  It's a horse... wearing armor... going to war.
cards.name: Armored Warhorse
cards.text: Battlecry: Reveal a minion in each deck. If yours costs more, gain Charge.

cards.flavor: Who argent watches the Argent Watchman?
cards.name: Argent Watchman
cards.text: Can't attack. Inspire: Can attack as normal this turn.

cards.flavor: Meets monthly with the gladiators to discuss career goals.
cards.name: Coliseum Manager
cards.text: Inspire: Return this minion to your hand.

cards.flavor: Menu:  Funnel cakes, carrots, popcorn, jormungar steaks.  It's hard serving a diverse clientele.
cards.name: Refreshment Vendor
cards.text: Battlecry: Restore #4 Health to each hero.

cards.flavor: Needs just a few more ratings points to become Grandmaster Jouster.
cards.name: Master Jouster
cards.text: Battlecry: Reveal a minion in each deck. If yours costs more, gain Taunt and Divine Shield.

cards.flavor: Join the Argent Crusade!  We have attractive tabards and you get to carry really nice swords!
cards.name: Recruiter
cards.text: Inspire: Add a 2/2 Squire to your hand.

cards.flavor: To be honest, heckling is not the most effective form of evil.
cards.name: Evil Heckler
cards.text: Taunt

cards.flavor: Good fencers make good neighbors, right?
cards.name: Fencing Coach
cards.text: Battlecry: The next time you use your Hero Power, it costs (2) less.

cards.flavor: Keeping tabs on the Grand Tournament is priority #1 for the five mighty Dragonflights!
cards.name: Wyrmrest Agent
cards.text: Battlecry: If you're holding a Dragon, gain +1 Attack and Taunt.

cards.flavor: Goes by "MC ElfyElf".
cards.name: Master of Ceremonies
cards.text: Battlecry: If you have a minion with Spell Damage, gain +2/+2.

cards.flavor: A veteran of a number of crusades, she is a force for light and goodness.  Her latest crusade is against goblin telemarketers.
cards.name: Grand Crusader
cards.text: Battlecry: Add a random Paladin card to your hand.

cards.flavor: Coming soon... to a tuskarr village near you!
cards.name: Kvaldir Raider
cards.text: Inspire: Gain +2/+2.

cards.flavor: Don't ask him about the beard.  JUST DON'T.
cards.name: Frost Giant
cards.text: Costs (1) less for each time you used your Hero Power this game.

cards.flavor: The crowd ALWAYS yells lethal.
cards.name: Crowd Favorite
cards.text: Whenever you play a card with Battlecry, gain +1/+1.

cards.flavor: Gormok has been giving impaling lessons in a small tent near the tournament grounds.  For only 25g you too could learn the fine art of impaling!
cards.name: Gormok the Impaler
cards.text: Battlecry: If you have at least 4 other minions, deal 4 damage.

cards.flavor: Chillmaw keeps trying to ruin the Grand Tournament, and she would've done it too, if it weren't for those dang kids!
cards.name: Chillmaw
cards.text: [x]Taunt Deathrattle: If you're holding a Dragon, deal 3 damage to all minions.

cards.flavor: Bolf keeps coming in 2nd at the Grand Tournament.  It might be his year this year, if Lebron doesn't enter.
cards.name: Bolf Ramshield
cards.text: Whenever your hero takes damage, this minion takes it instead.

cards.flavor: This massive yeti just closes his eyes and charges at the nearest target.  The nearest Target is a couple blocks away and has sick deals on skateboards.
cards.name: Icehowl
cards.text: Charge Can't attack heroes.

cards.flavor: The ethereals have their own jousting tournament, and Saraad is the reigning champion.  Also he won the ethereal hot dog eating contest.
cards.name: Nexus-Champion Saraad
cards.text: Inspire: Add a random spell to your hand.

cards.flavor: Apparently it really was just a flesh wound.
cards.name: The Skeleton Knight
cards.text: Deathrattle: Reveal a minion in each deck. If yours costs more, return this to your hand.

cards.flavor: LOVES being called "the wonder twins".
cards.name: Fjola Lightbane
cards.text: Whenever you target this minion with a spell, gain Divine Shield.

cards.flavor: A little better than Sea Minus Reaver.
cards.name: Sea Reaver
cards.text: When you draw this, deal 1 damage to your minions.

cards.flavor: HATES being called "the wonder twins".
cards.name: Eydis Darkbane
cards.text: Whenever you target this minion with a spell, deal 3 damage to a random enemy.

cards.flavor: It's like putting racing stripes and a giant spoiler on your hero power.
cards.name: Justicar Trueheart
cards.text: Battlecry: Replace your starting Hero Power with a better one.

cards.flavor: It's not HER fault you didn't put a spinning saw blade on your horse.
cards.name: Gadgetzan Jouster
cards.text: Battlecry: Reveal a minion in each deck. If yours costs more, gain +1/+1.

cards.flavor:
"See you later bot"
- Jaina
cards.name: Skaterbot
cards.text: Magnetic Rush

cards.flavor: "You have my shield! And the rest of me too."
cards.name: Bronze Gatekeeper
cards.text: Magnetic Taunt

cards.flavor: They're Dr. Boom's babies. His baby boomers.
cards.name: Goblin Bomb
cards.text: [x]Deathrattle: Deal 2 damage to the enemy hero.

cards.flavor: Me throw face.
cards.name: Bomb Toss
cards.text: Deal $2 damage. Summon a 0/2 Goblin Bomb.

cards.flavor: Every good plan requires a bit of patience. And a lot of explosives.
cards.name: Boommaster Flark
cards.text: Battlecry: Summon four 0/2 Goblin Bombs.

cards.flavor: Keeps getting banned for toxic behavior.
cards.name: Venomizer
cards.text: Magnetic Poisonous

cards.flavor: She learns by trial and error.  Mostly error.
cards.name: Fireworks Tech
cards.text: [x]Battlecry: Give a friendly Mech +1/+1. If it has Deathrattle, trigger it.

cards.flavor: If at first you don't succeed, die, die again.
cards.name: Necromechanic
cards.text: Your Deathrattles trigger twice.

cards.flavor: Harrison Jones was kicked off this project.
cards.name: Weapons Project
cards.text:
Each player equips a 2/3 Weapon and
gains 6 Armor.

cards.flavor: Ironic. It could recycle others, but not itself.
cards.name: Rusty Recycler
cards.text: Taunt Lifesteal

cards.flavor:
Step 1: Grow giant evil strawberry.
Step 2: ????
Step 3: Rule Azeroth!
cards.name: Biology Project
cards.text: Each player gains 2 Mana Crystals.

cards.flavor: He's all beeps and smiles but you're just a walking pile of armor to him.
cards.name: Eternium Rover
cards.text: Whenever this minion takes damage, gain 2 Armor.

cards.flavor: "Well if I didn't build the whelp and YOU didn't build the whelp…"
cards.name: Mechanical Whelp
cards.text: Deathrattle: Summon a 7/7 Mechanical Dragon.

cards.flavor: This is the happiest moment of Grik's life. We'll miss him.
cards.name: Rocket Boots
cards.text: Give a minion Rush. Draw a card.

cards.flavor: Dr. Boom ends his motivational speeches by dropping the mechs.
cards.name: The Boomship
cards.text: Summon 3 random minions from your hand. Give them Rush.

cards.flavor: They're a little light-headed.
cards.name: Faithful Lumi
cards.text: Battlecry: Give a friendly Mech +1/+1.

cards.flavor: Double-majoring in culinary sciences was definitely a mistake.
cards.name: Toxicologist
cards.text: Battlecry: Give your weapon +1 Attack.

cards.flavor: Elite Tauren Chieftain's next hit single.
cards.name: Violet Haze
cards.text: Add 2 random Deathrattle cards to your hand.

cards.flavor: The tenth Pyroblast really felt like overkill.
cards.name: Academic Espionage
cards.text: Shuffle 10 cards from your opponent's class into your deck. They cost (1).

cards.flavor: It's just a Tempest Tantrum.
cards.name: Elementary Reaction
cards.text: Draw a card. Copy it if you played an Elemental last turn.

cards.flavor: After a stressful work day it really needs an outlet.
cards.name: Unpowered Mauler
cards.text: Can only attack if you cast a spell this turn.

cards.flavor: Genius is 1% inspiration, and 99% drawing your Deathwing.
cards.name: Eureka!
cards.text: Summon a copy of a random minion from your hand.

cards.flavor: Let's see what's behind rift number one!
cards.name: Astral Rift
cards.text: Add 2 random minions to your hand.

cards.flavor: Preferred weapon of Dr. Boom's orthodontist.

cards.flavor: He keeps earthinating the countryside despite attempts to stop him.

cards.flavor: PREPARE PARTY SERVOS FOR IMMEDIATE DEPLOYMENT.

cards.flavor: It's hard to make a living as a hunter in a world where beasts instantly reappear minutes after you kill them.

Whenever this minion takes
damage, gain +2 Attack.

cards.flavor: What doesn't kill you makes you toxic.

cards.flavor: He's a very literal dog.

cards.flavor: Cleans even the toughest clogs with just a flick of the wrist!

cards.flavor: We'll thaw you out when we find a cure!

cards.flavor: Excuse me. Your mountain is on fire.

cards.flavor: For the close shave that you've always wanted. Caution: Very sharp.

cards.flavor: "Oil," "Rail," and "Blubber" were already taken.

cards.flavor: Wearing purple after the holidays? GHASTLY!

cards.flavor: These sorrows cut deep.

cards.flavor: He's deathspicable.

cards.flavor: One of our more snowbally cards.

cards.flavor: It's rude to gnash with your mouth open.
cards.name: Gnash

cards.flavor: Sometimes, the best defense is an offensive troll.

cards.text: Taunt Overload: (3)

cards.flavor: It's like déjà vu, times two.

cards.text: Secret: After your opponent plays a minion, add two copies of it to your hand.

cards.flavor: Jaina was never good at keeping up apprentices.

cards.name: Ultimate Infestation

[x]Deal $5 damage. Draw
5 cards. Gain 5 Armor.
Summon a 5/5 Ghoul.

cards.flavor: The secret is in the frosting.

cards.text: Put one of each Secret from your deck into the battlefield.

cards.flavor: The Silver Hand recruits shuddered in terror when they saw the dreaded totem of the Hexxer: A tiny little snowman, impaled with pins.
cards.name: Voodoo Hexxer
cards.text: Taunt Freeze any character damaged by this minion.

cards.flavor: Glow fish, war fish... blow fish, more fish...

cards.flavor: This minion goes all the way to 11!

cards.text: Costs (1) less for each Mana Crystal you've Overloaded this game.

cards.flavor: I got two pair, Rags and Armorsmiths. What you got?

cards.flavor: This is my Runeblade. There are many like it but this one is mine.

cards.text: Battlecry: Give a friendly minion +1 Attack.

cards.text: Battlecry: Give a friendly minion Spell Damage +1.

cards.flavor: It's hard to keep a Shattered Sun Cleric down.

cards.text: Battlecry: Give a friendly minion +1/+1.

cards.flavor: Smelts in his mouth, not in your hand.

cards.flavor: I think one of the necromancers got a little carried away.

cards.flavor: She hangs out in all the tombs, but she rarely posts.

cards.flavor: Abomination. Emphasis on the second syllable.

cards.flavor: Snakes on a frozen plain.

cards.text: Secret: When one of your minions is attacked, summon a 2/3 Poisonous Cobra.

cards.flavor: Call it: Heads or Tailbone…

cards.text: After you play a Secret, put a random Hunter Secret into the battlefield.

cards.flavor: Never look a gift minion in the mouth.

cards.flavor: A mind is a terrible thing to waste. Seconds, anyone?

cards.text:
[x]At the end of your turn,
give another random
friendly minion +1/+1.

cards.flavor: It takes many years of practiced study in order to fully master agony.

cards.text: Lifesteal

cards.flavor: What do you mean I don't get overtime pay for this?!

cards.text: Discover a friendly minion that died this game. Summon it.

cards.flavor: The original artist spent many hours with a fine chisel perfecting the facial expression for maximum tauntiness.

cards.flavor: Nobody expects the Archbishop's Benediction!

cards.flavor: Difficult to bottle up and sell. But it packs a punch.
cards.name: Shadow Essence
cards.text: Summon a 5/5 copy of a random minion in your deck.

cards.flavor: A great way to end a conversation.

cards.text: Destroy any Frozen minion damaged by this.

cards.flavor: He'd be a lot easier to animate if he would just stand still.

cards.flavor: Don't worry, he'll keep an eye on that for you.

cards.flavor: "Did I ever tell you the story of when I single-handedly took down a 29/29 C'thun?" - Reno Jackson

cards.flavor: "All that I am: anger, cruelty, vengeance, 8 attack - I bestow upon you, my chosen knight."

cards.text: [x]Taunt At the end of your turn, add a random Death Knight card to your hand.

cards.flavor: Daddy! I think I made a Legendary!

cards.text: [x]After this minion survives damage, summon a random Legendary minion.

cards.flavor: She prefers the term "Glampire."

cards.text: Battlecry: Remove the top card of your opponent's deck.

cards.flavor: My Ghoul friend is back and you're gonna be in trouble.

cards.text:
[x]After this minion
survives damage,
summon a 2/2 Ghoul.

cards.flavor: He's just exercising his right to bear arms.

cards.flavor: "Candygram."

cards.flavor: How's everyone doing? Hurt? Bleeding? Wounded? ... Excellent.

cards.flavor: Desperately needs some alone time.

cards.flavor: It helps to speak really, really loud.

cards.text: Battlecry: Give a friendly minion Immune this turn.

cards.flavor: If you ever tried to plow permafrost, you’d be wretched, too.

cards.flavor: Stand right... there. Perfect, perfect! Now don't move.

cards.flavor: "Do not be afraid. Approach. The dead will sleep… for now."

cards.flavor: When life gives you snow…

cards.flavor: It's as though a million Jade Idols cried out, and were suddenly silenced.

cards.flavor: It's hard to put them six feet under when you're three feet tall.

cards.text: Deathrattle: Add a random Deathrattle minion to your hand.

cards.flavor: Attacks her job with unbridled enthusiasm.

cards.text: Battlecry: Give a friendly minion +4/+4 and Taunt.

cards.flavor: He loves a good yarn.
cards.name: Nerubian Unraveler
cards.text: Spells cost (2) more.

cards.flavor: Enlistment in her battalion comes with several pairs of earplugs.

cards.flavor: We've got spirit, yes we do! We've got spirit, stolen from you!

cards.flavor: It isn't "grave robbing" when there's no grave. It's just scavenging…

cards.flavor: The original fifth beetle!
cards.name: Crypt Lord
cards.text: [x]Taunt After you summon a minion, gain +1 Health.

cards.flavor: The excruciating pain means it's working!

cards.flavor: Don't fear the Arcanite Reaper.

cards.text: Battlecry: Give a random Lifesteal minion in your hand +2/+2.

cards.flavor: She doesn't feel pity, or remorse, or fear. And she absolutely will not stop... ever, until all necromancers are dead.

cards.flavor: Necromancers call it "Meals on Wheels."
cards.name: Meat Wagon
cards.text: [x]Deathrattle: Summon a minion from your deck with less Attack than this minion.

cards.flavor: It slices, it dices, it vaporizes! The Chillblade will make a Champion out of even the lowliest gnome.

cards.text: Charge Lifesteal

cards.flavor: It's like déjà vu, times two.
cards.name: Simulacrum
cards.text: Copy the lowest Cost minion in your hand.

cards.flavor: Frosty the Bowman... was an angry hateful soul... with a fresh hewn bow and a missing nose...
cards.name: Abominable Bowman
cards.text: [x]Deathrattle: Summon a random friendly Beast that died this game.

cards.flavor: "Run away. Hide in your precious keeps, behind your walls and your bodyguards. Night always falls, and shadows will fill your hallowed halls. One day, one of those shadows will be me."
cards.name: Valeera the Hollow
cards.text: Battlecry: Gain Stealth until your next turn.

cards.flavor: "You were too slow, old friend. The hunt began long ago. And now... it will never end."
cards.name: Deathstalker Rexxar
cards.text: [x]Battlecry: Deal 2 damage to all enemy minions.

cards.flavor: "Step forward. Confess! Once I was a mere servant of the Light. Now I alone stand in judgement."
cards.name: Uther of the Ebon Blade
cards.text: Battlecry: Equip a 5/3 Lifesteal weapon.

cards.flavor: "I will tell you what Velen never taught me. Whosoever stands before the Light… inevitably casts a shadow."
cards.name: Shadowreaper Anduin
cards.text: Battlecry: Destroy all minions with 5 or more Attack.

cards.flavor: "Still you refuse to bend your knee? None can escape death, you old fool. And in death… all will serve me…"
cards.name: Bloodreaver Gul'dan
cards.text: Battlecry: Summon all friendly Demons that died this game.

cards.flavor: "Cenarius once taught me about the precarious balance between life and death. I have come to understand: there IS no balance. Death always wins."
cards.name: Malfurion the Pestilent
cards.text: [x]Choose One - Summon 2 Poisonous Spiders; or 2 Scarabs with Taunt.

cards.flavor: "Arthas was a spoiled child, playing with toys he could neither control nor understand. Come into the cold. I will show you the true power of the Frozen Throne."
cards.name: Frost Lich Jaina
cards.text: [x]Battlecry: Summon a 3/6 Water Elemental. Your Elementals have Lifesteal this game.

cards.flavor: "You dare to challenge me? Come! Draw your last breath - and then, you are mine."
cards.name: Scourgelord Garrosh
cards.text: Battlecry: Equip a 4/3 Shadowmourne that also damages adjacent minions.

cards.flavor: The viziers of Azjol-Nerub released Hadronox as a last-ditch effort to hold back the Lich King. They did so by VERY carefully scooping him up in a LARGE newspaper and releasing him.
cards.name: Hadronox
cards.text: Deathrattle: Summon your Taunt minions that died this game.

cards.flavor: Is it cold in here or is it just Sindragosa?
cards.name: Breath of Sindragosa
cards.text: Deal $2 damage to a random enemy minion and Freeze it.

cards.flavor: Brrr, it's cold in here. Let's hope she doesn't have an Auctioneer!
cards.name: Bring It On!
cards.text: Gain 10 Armor. Reduce the Cost of minions in your opponent's hand by (2).

cards.flavor: "I recognize your effort but I think your magic still has room for improvement." - Sindragosa after taking a class on giving constructive feedback.
cards.name: Sindragosa
cards.text: Battlecry: Summon two 0/1 Frozen Champions.

cards.flavor: As a young blood-princess she learned the proper way for a lady to curtsy, how to address fellow members of royalty, and how to bite them.
cards.name: Blood-Queen Lana'thel
cards.text: [x]Lifesteal Has +1 Attack for each card you've discarded this game.

cards.flavor: Once you both get comfortable, darkness is actually pretty snuggly.
cards.name: Embrace Darkness
cards.text:
[x]Choose an enemy minion.
At the start of your turn,
gain control of it.

cards.flavor: It's tacky to call it "Shadeblade."
cards.name: Shadowblade
cards.text: Battlecry: Your hero is Immune this turn.

cards.flavor: Three Princes stand before you. This one wants to buff his brothers.
cards.name: Prince Keleseth

cards.flavor: Three Princes stand before you. This one wants to copy others.
cards.name: Prince Taldaram
cards.text: Battlecry: If your deck has no 3-Cost cards, transform into a 3/3 copy of a minion.

cards.flavor: Three Princes stand before you. This one devours one after another.
cards.name: Prince Valanar
cards.text: Battlecry: If your deck has no 4-Cost cards, gain Lifesteal and Taunt.

cards.flavor: There must always be a Lick King.
cards.name: Arfus
cards.text: Deathrattle: Add a random Death Knight card to your hand.

cards.flavor: Don't be fooled, that polar bear's the one in charge.
cards.name: Hyldnir Frostrider
cards.text: Battlecry: Freeze your other minions.

cards.flavor: Spells offer twice the moisture wicking of cotton.

cards.text: Spell Damage +2

cards.flavor: He's so hot right now.
cards.name: Bolvar, Fireblood
cards.text: Divine Shield After a friendly minion loses Divine Shield, gain +2 Attack.

cards.flavor: An eye for an eye, and a ghoul for a ghoul.
cards.name: Necrotic Geist
cards.text: Whenever one of your other minions dies, summon a 2/2 Ghoul.

cards.flavor: Drakkari sorceresses have the irritating habit of repeating themselves at the end of every sentence. Every sentence.

cards.text: Your end of turn effects trigger twice.

cards.flavor: He's a mind breaker, dream taker, ghoul trainer, don't you mess around with him.

cards.flavor: Have some! This drink is to die for!
cards.name: Sanguine Reveler
cards.text: Battlecry: Destroy a friendly minion and gain +2/+2.

cards.flavor: It's minions like these that give normal, law-abiding skeletons a bad rap.

cards.text: Battlecry: Gain +1/+1 for each minion that died this turn.

cards.flavor: Queen Lana'thel insists on one of these, fried, every morning for breakfast.

cards.text: Divine Shield Spell Damage +1

cards.flavor: "I know some new tricks, a lot of good tricks. I will show them to you. Medivh will not mind at all if I do."

cards.flavor: "Goodness! What… abundant drool you have."

cards.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in the Opera, in One Night in Karazhan.

cards.flavor: She's practically GIVING your secrets away!

cards.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in the Parlor, in One Night in Karazhan.

cards.flavor: Question: What's scarier, one giant angry dinosaur or 15 smaller vicious ones? Answer: AHHHHHHH THEY FOUND MEEEEEE
cards.name: The Marsh Queen
cards.text: [x]Quest: Play seven 1-Cost minions. Reward: Queen Carnassa.

cards.flavor: It turns out cards DO grow on trees!
cards.name: Explore Un'Goro
cards.text: Replace your deck with copies of "Discover a card."

cards.flavor: Week 6. I remain covered head to toe with scales. They do not yet realize that I am not a dinosaur.
cards.name: Iron Hide
cards.text: Gain 5 Armor.

cards.flavor: "It's an herbivore.  How dangerous can it be?"  - Famous last words
cards.name: Ornery Direhorn
cards.text: Taunt Battlecry: Adapt.

cards.flavor: The Draenei are seriously considering cancelling "Bring Your Murderous Pet to Work Day."
cards.name: Cornered Sentry
cards.text: Taunt. Battlecry: Summon three 1/1 Raptors for your opponent.

cards.flavor: Being hurt can make you another person.
cards.name: Sudden Genesis
cards.text: Summon copies of your damaged minions.

cards.flavor: If you won't come to the tar pits, we'll bring them to you!
cards.name: Tar Creeper
cards.text: Taunt Has +2 Attack during your opponent's turn.

cards.flavor: It’s a sword! It’s a knife! It’s a swizzle-stick!
cards.name: Molten Blade
cards.text: Each turn this is in your hand, transform it into a new weapon.

cards.flavor: He's a terror at concerts.
cards.name: King Mosh
cards.text: Battlecry: Destroy all damaged minions.

cards.flavor: Why does an active volcano need to be defended? To save its ash.
cards.name: Fire Plume's Heart
cards.text: [x]Quest: Play 7 Taunt minions. Reward: Sulfuras.

cards.flavor: Lookout is a self-appointed title that's mostly an excuse to beat things up.
cards.name: Primalfin Lookout
cards.text: Battlecry: If you control another Murloc, Discover a Murloc.

cards.flavor: NONE SHALL PASS until at least an hour after eating.
cards.name: Hot Spring Guardian
cards.text: Taunt Battlecry: Restore #3 Health.

cards.flavor: They keep hitting the Snooze button.
cards.name: Awaken the Makers
cards.text: Quest: Summon 7 Deathrattle minions. Reward: Amara, Warden of Hope.

cards.flavor: It's the Ancient Tol'vir symbol for "Whoops!"
cards.name: Primordial Glyph
cards.text: Discover a spell. Reduce its Cost by (2).

cards.flavor: Form feet and legs!  Form arms and body!  Oh.  Sorry.  I was thinking about Mechafin.
cards.name: Unite the Murlocs
cards.text: [x]Quest: Summon 10 Murlocs. Reward: Megafin.

cards.flavor: Three time winner of the Un'Goro weapon eating contest.
cards.name: Gluttonous Ooze
cards.text: Battlecry: Destroy your opponent's weapon and gain Armor equal to its Attack.

cards.flavor: Dang, I'm looking pretty hot!
cards.name: Molten Reflection
cards.text: Choose a friendly minion. Summon a copy of it.

cards.flavor: George and Karl!  Thank the Light we found you!
cards.name: Vinecleaver
cards.text:
[x]After your hero attacks,
summon two 1/1 Silver
Hand Recruits.

cards.flavor: What beats cavalry? Dinosaur cavalry.
cards.name: Spikeridged Steed
cards.text: Give a minion +2/+6 and Taunt. When it dies, summon a Stegodon.

cards.flavor: Sure, he'll return your stuff.  OVER HIS DEAD BODY!
cards.name: Primalfin Champion
cards.text: [x]Deathrattle: Return any spells you cast on this minion to your hand.

cards.flavor: “Impossible!” exclaimed the Silver Hand Recruit, his eyes filled with fear. Uther shook his head, turning the crystal until it caught the light: “Life finds a way.”
cards.name: The Last Kaleidosaur
cards.text: Quest: Cast 6 spells on your minions. Reward: Galvadon.

cards.flavor: When you absolutely, positively have to kill all the dinosaurs.
cards.name: Meteor
cards.text: Deal $15 damage to a minion and $3 damage to adjacent ones.

cards.flavor: I guess you can say they’re… “soul survivors.”
cards.name: Spirit Echo
cards.text: Give your minions "Deathrattle: Return  this to your hand."

cards.flavor: His mom could beat up your mom.
cards.name: Direhorn Hatchling
cards.text: Taunt Deathrattle: Shuffle a 6/9 Direhorn with Taunt into your deck.

cards.flavor: George and Karl were never heard from again.
cards.name: Lost in the Jungle
cards.text: Summon two 1/1 Silver Hand Recruits.

cards.flavor: Pray for salvation. If that fails, pray for extra horns or bigger teeth.
cards.name: Adaptation
cards.text: Adapt a friendly minion.

cards.flavor: “Come now, Johnston. I think those horns are quite fetching on you.”
cards.name: Lightfused Stegodon
cards.text: Battlecry: Adapt your Silver Hand Recruits.

cards.flavor: Arise, fair sun, and kill my envious foes. They don't have a legendary as beautiful as you.
cards.name: Lyra the Sunshard
cards.text: Whenever you cast a spell, add a random Priest spell to your hand.
